results.title: Inside radio
results.brief_description: Shows how a radio program is created and features, among others, a disk jockey and a young radio interviewer who discuss the style of writing and speaking suitable for a young audience.

results.title: Inside Newfoundland
results.creator_credit: Roger Morin, Sydney Newman and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Canada’s tenth province—its people, its resources, its way of life. The camera shows us St. John’s, the capital city; Cornerbrook, pulp and paper center; and Bell Island with its iron mine. The greatest wealth of Newfoundland is her people, and a visit with Fred Greeley, inshore fisherman and his family, introduces us to our fellow Canadians. Finally the importance of Newfoundland’s airports is stressed, and we visit Gander, where international air travellers come and go from the four corners of the globe.

results.title: Inside Magoo
results.creator_credit: John F. Becker, Stephen Bosustow, American Cancer Society and United Productions of America
results.brief_description: A highly entertaining and informative educational film combining both animation and live-action explaining the seven danger signals of cancer. Underlines the importance of regular medical check-ups to guard your health. Stresses the need for early diagnosis before cancer has spread throughout the body. Featuring Jim Backus in the role of Mr Magoo.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John F. Becker, Stephen Bosustow, American Cancer Society and United Productions of America

results.title: Insects: a world of diversity (MAC)
results.brief_description: SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Apple Macintosh computer, 13 inch colour monitor (or larger), 4MB RAM, CD-ROM drive. Spectacular insect fauna comes to life in a unique exploration of biological diversity. This is a multimedia experience that will inform and inspire an exploration of the insect world. It has been designed to be of value to everybody interested in nature, from primary school age and up. Includes colour photographs of live insects, recordings of sound producing insects, digital video documentaries and information on identifying, catching and keeping insects.

results.brief_description: Two children make an insect zoo in their yard. By close-up photography several insects are distinguished and simple homes in which they can be kept are shown.

results.title: Insearch of viewable objects
results.creator_credit: Jane Nicholls and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Traces the life of the voyeur, showing the pleasure, pain and confusion. This is a student film which explores the main character’s voyeuristic experiences from boyhood to manhood who, eventually has the cameras turned on him at the end of the film - the “watcher” has now become the “watched”! Cinematography by John Tweg.

results.title: Inner Rhythm
results.brief_description: This documentary goes behind the scenes to discover the relationship between a composer and a choreographer. John Lang, Ahmed Hassen, Robert Desrosiers and the National Ballet of Canada are featured.

results.title: Inner city, by West Coast artist Michael McMillen: a film
results.brief_description: The neglected exterior quality of Inner City is an environmental sculpture which takes us to the veiled border between illusion and reality. Michael McMillen began building Inner City in 1975, finishing it in Nov 1977 for the opening of his one-man exhibition at the Los Angeles County Museum of Art.

results.title: Inland with Sturt
results.creator_credit: Hugh McInnes, Shan Benson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The historic journey of explorer Charles Sturt down the Murrumbidgee and Murray Rivers opened up one of the world’s most prosperous fruit and cereal growing areas. The re-enactment of the trip by a group of young Australians, as recorded in this film, was one of the highlights of the Australian Commonwealth Jubilee Celebrations.

results.title: Inje: lost in translation
results.creator_credit: Pippa Bailey, Australian Film Commission, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Seahorse Productions
results.brief_description: A very interesting documentary about an artistic collaboration between Australia and Bulgaria involving the Hildegard Theatre Company from Melbourne, Australia and a group of Bulgarian actors led by avant garde theatre director Vaskressia Vicharova in Bulgaria. The Hildegard Theatre Company’s passion for Bulgarian folklore inspired them to initiate a joint production of bi-lingual theatre to travel Australia during 1996 - their choice of performance being the heroic legend of “Inje” a fearless war-lord and bandit. Angela Campbell and Bagryana Popov, artistic directors for Hildegard, and David Wicks, theatre director, headed the Australian company in Bulgaria where the collaboration suffered enormously during the rehearsal process. Differences in interpretation of the narrative, directing methods, and acting methods gradually created a rift between the two groups. However, what was even more noticeable was the cultural and language divide causing breakdown in communication, frustration, tension, and for some Australian actors, alienation. But for all of this personal drama which took place, when the production finally arrived in Australia, tolerance, understanding, and a new found respect developed between the directors and actors of both countries, with friendships being formed and the language barrier being broken down. Filmed partly in Bulgaria and partly in Australia, in English and Bulgarian (with English subtitles). Also features music by Petrunka (The Melburne Women’s Bulgarian Choir) conducted by Bagryana Popov. Narrated by Alex Menglet.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pippa Bailey, Australian Film Commission, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Seahorse Productions
